Using omicidx with BigQuery

Vince Carey1

Source: vignettes/bigquery.Rmd
bigquery.Rmd

Introduction

This vignette can be used if the following code can succeed.

bq_auth() # may need to do some gcloud configuration
con = bigrquery::dbConnect(bigquery(), 
    project="isb-cgc-01-0006", 
    dataset="omicidx", billing=Sys.getenv("BQ_BILLING"))

This vignette reviews basic aspects of interacting with omicidx as exposed through Google BigQuery.

Setup

See the basic omicidx documentation to establish an account for BigQuery. The documentation also indicates how to set up a project for billing. Charges for a query depend on the quantity of data scanned.

The following commands establish a connection to the omicidx dataset in BigQuery. This resource is updated approximately monthly.

library(bigrquery)
library(dplyr)
bq_auth() # may need to do some gcloud configuration, supply gargle_oauth_email for identity
con = bigrquery::dbConnect(bigquery(), 
    project="isb-cgc-01-0006", 
    dataset="omicidx", billing=[provide billing code])

Once authentication has succeeded, the available tables may be listed. If you do not provide a billing code, certain operations that don’t involve scanning tables can succeed, but select and filter operations will fail because they involve creating temporary tables.

dbListTables(con)
con %>% tbl("sra_study") %>% 
   select(study_type) %>% 
   group_by(study_type) %>% 
   summarise(n=n())

Inspecting a table
